column2: But, she uttered no sound; and so strong was the voice within her, representing that it was she of all the world who must uphold him in his misery and not augment it, that it quickly raised her, even from that shock.

column2: The people had all poured out to the show in the streets.

column2: Barsad proposed to the rest, "Let her embrace him then; it is but a moment." It was silently acquiesced in, and they passed her over the seats in the hall to a raised place, where he, by leaning over the dock, could fold her in his arms.

column3: We know, now what you underwent when you suspected my descent, and when you knew it.

column2: We know now, the natural antipathy you strove against, and conquered, for her dear sake.

column2: We thank you with all our hearts, and all our love and duty.
column3: We thank you with all our hearts, and all our love and duty.

column2: Heaven be with you!"

column2: As he went out at the prisoners' door, she turned, laid her head lovingly on her father's breast, tried to speak to him, and fell at his feet.

column2: Only her father and Mr. Lorry were with her.

column2: His arm trembled as it raised her, and supported her head. Yet, there was an air about him that was not all of pity--that had a flush of pride in it.

column2: He carried her lightly to the door, and laid her tenderly down in a coach.
column3: He carried her lightly to the door, and laid her tenderly down in a coach.

column2: Her father and their old friend got into it, and he took his seat beside the driver.
column3: Her father and their old friend got into it, and he took his seat beside the driver.

column2: When they arrived at the gateway where he had paused in the dark not many hours before, to picture to himself on which of the rough stones of the street her feet had trodden, he lifted her again, and carried her up the staircase to their rooms.
